update.description:
Adds 3 depth cameras: Asus Xtion Pro, Orbbec Astra, Intel RealSense R200.

FOV parameters, resolution, range were determined from manufacturer specifications.

Left to right: Realsense, Xtion, Orbbec, with Kinect in the background for reference. They are very dark, but the ambient on each COLLADA file is set to (1,1,1) -- this is just their normal color.

![Screenshot from 2017-05-04 11-53-32.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/EgGzpd/images/2408855611-Screenshot%20from%202017-05-04%2011-53-32.png)
update.title: Depth cameras

content.raw:
I bumped the specular and emissive up to 0.5 for all 3. Here they are now:
![Screenshot from 2017-05-16 17-41-29.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/EgGzpd/images/1710741961-Screenshot_from_2017-05-16_17-41-29.png)
Thanks!
content.html: I bumped the specular and emissive up to 0.5 for all 3. Here they are now: Thanks!

update.description:
Adds 3 depth cameras: Asus Xtion Pro, Orbbec Astra, Intel RealSense R200.

FOV parameters, resolution, range were determined from manufacturer specifications.

Left to right: Realsense, Xtion, Orbbec, with Kinect in the background for reference. They are very dark, but the ambient on each COLLADA file is set to (1,1,1) -- this is just their normal color.

![Screenshot from 2017-05-04 11-53-32.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/EgGzpd/images/2408855611-Screenshot%20from%202017-05-04%2011-53-32.png)
update.title: Depth cameras

content.raw:
I think we could play with the emission and specular colors to try and make them less dark. For example, with this diff:

~~~
diff -r 79622d2f8fa0 asus_xtion_pro_camera/meshes/asus_xtion_pro_camera.dae
--- a/asus_xtion_pro_camera/meshes/asus_xtion_pro_camera.dae	Wed May 10 16:18:06 2017 -0700
+++ b/asus_xtion_pro_camera/meshes/asus_xtion_pro_camera.dae	Tue May 16 14:20:03 2017 -0700
@@ -31,7 +31,7 @@
         <technique sid="common">
           <phong>
             <emission>
-              <color sid="emission">0 0 0 1</color>
+              <color sid="emission">1 1 1 1</color>
             </emission>
             <ambient>
               <color sid="ambient">1 1 1 1</color>
@@ -40,7 +40,7 @@
               <texture texture="asus_xtion_pro_camera_tex-sampler" texcoord="UVMap"/>
             </diffuse>
             <specular>
-              <color sid="specular">0.5 0.5 0.5 1</color>
+              <color sid="specular">1 1 1 1</color>
             </specular>
             <shininess>
               <float sid="shininess">50</float>
~~~

real | current | shiny
----- | ----- | -----
![asusreal.jpeg](data/bitbucket.org/repo/EgGzpd/images/732144380-asusreal.jpeg) | ![asuscurrent.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/EgGzpd/images/399688566-asuscurrent.png) | ![asusshiny.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/EgGzpd/images/1571734598-asusshiny.png)
content.html:
I think we could play with the emission and specular colors to try and make them less dark. For example, with this diff:

diff -r 79622d2f8fa0 asus_xtion_pro_camera/meshes/asus_xtion_pro_camera.dae
--- a/asus_xtion_pro_camera/meshes/asus_xtion_pro_camera.dae    Wed May 10 16:18:06 2017 -0700
+++ b/asus_xtion_pro_camera/meshes/asus_xtion_pro_camera.dae    Tue May 16 14:20:03 2017 -0700
@@ -31,7 +31,7 @@
         <technique sid="common">
           <phong>
             <emission>
-              <color sid="emission">0 0 0 1</color>
+              <color sid="emission">1 1 1 1</color>
             </emission>
             <ambient>
               <color sid="ambient">1 1 1 1</color>
@@ -40,7 +40,7 @@
               <texture texture="asus_xtion_pro_camera_tex-sampler" texcoord="UVMap"/>
             </diffuse>
             <specular>
-              <color sid="specular">0.5 0.5 0.5 1</color>
+              <color sid="specular">1 1 1 1</color>
             </specular>
             <shininess>
               <float sid="shininess">50</float>
real current shiny

content.raw:
The Asus seems to be the only one with unrealistic inertia:

![asusinertia.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/EgGzpd/images/3456353372-asusinertia.png)
content.html: The Asus seems to be the only one with unrealistic inertia:

update.title: Depth cameras

content.raw: let's leave the kinect for now, and add offsets to just these three
content.html: let's leave the kinect for now, and add offsets to just these three

content.raw: I was following the lead of the Kinect, which has no offset, but there probably should be one for realism. Should I add an offset to the Kinect, or do you think it would break existing use cases?
content.html: I was following the lead of the Kinect, which has no offset, but there probably should be one for realism. Should I add an offset to the Kinect, or do you think it would break existing use cases?

content.raw: ticketed [this depth camera min distance issue](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/issues/2275/depth-camera-min-distance-modeled-as-near) while reviewing this PR
content.html: ticketed this depth camera min distance issue while reviewing this PR

content.raw: is there a pose offset between the sensor and the model?
content.html: is there a pose offset between the sensor and the model?

content.raw: add `z` offset like the [kinect model pose](#!/osrf/gazebo_models/src/c76c171d4b3893312fa440737fb6bbe5d01b3bf2/kinect/model.sdf?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#model.sdf-4) so that it sits above the ground plane when spawned?
content.html: add z offset like the kinect model pose so that it sits above the ground plane when spawned?
